events.name: Spring Indoor Planting
events.description: The event is to demonstrate how to prepare your garden from the very start. We will start with seeding indoors and develop the plants into saplings that can be then planted outdoors successfully.This workshop is sponsored by Social Services Network in partnership with the city of Markham Aaniin Community Hub.

events.name: The Great Indoors: an online soundscapes workshop
events.description: The Great Indoors is an audio editing/soundscape production workshop meant to give participants an opportunity to (re)discover the interior spaces we occupy during the pandemic.This collaborative, participatory workshop will encourage sonic connections between physically distanced participants. By sharing our acoustic spaces, we can find commonality between each other and create a space for empathy and care.Over the course of this 90-minute workshop, workshop participants will walk through creating soundscapes from our indoor sonic environment. Starting with a brief presentation on sonic encounter, participants will be invited to explore their homes/apartments to record sounds with their phones/recording devices. The second portion of the workshop will involve a short overview on how to compose soundscapes in Audacity, an open-source audio editing software. Participants will upload their recordings to a shared drive (Dropbox/Google Drive) and will have time to put together a soundscape with everyone’s recordings. At the end of the workshop, we will share our soundscapes together.

events.name: TSpring Indoor Planting
events.description: The event is to demonstrate how to prepare your garden from the very start. We will start with seeding indoors and develop the plants into saplings that can be then planted outdoors successfully.

events.name: Make a Traditional Italian Easter Dish
events.description:
Looking for things to make at home this Easter? Why not try your hand at Italian cooking with this delicious and traditional Easter dish?
 In this cooking class online, you will make an Italian Easter cake which is a savoury cake, typical of the Genoese Easter tradition. It is lovingly prepared with a crunchy handmade pastry dough and a delicious filling.
 It is made to celebrate the spring and the awakening of nature but it also symbolises the resurrection of Jesus Christ on Easter Sunday.
 Don't worry if you're new to cooking, this relaxed virtual cooking class is ideal for beginners as there will be plenty of guidance, step-by-step instruction and friendly chit-chat. There will also be plenty of opportunities to ask questions and of course, taste-test!
 At the end of this virtual class, you'll have made an authentic savoury Easter cake and will be able to dig into as it's hot and fresh from the oven. This hearty dish is a great recipe to have in your repertoire as it's perfect for buffets or even for a trip out of town, this cake will definitely make its way to your heart once you try it - it is truly irresistible!

events.name: Women Walking Mastermind™ Networking Group 2021 (Monthly Virtual Event)
events.description:
Let's Walk toward Building a Community 
 The Women Walking Mastermind Networking Group™ is your opportunity to create meaningful conversations with women business leaders while being outdoors. We believe nature impacts connection, creativity, and new perspectives.
 WHILE WE USED TO MEET OUTDOORS - PLEASE NOTE THAT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE THE EVENT IS VIRTUAL - YOU ARE STILL WELCOME TO WALK OR BE OUTDOORS WHILE JOINING US. RSVP TO RECEIVE THE ZOOM LINK.

events.name: Seasonal cooking: a chef's guide to local food
events.description:
Do you ever get stuck for recipes ideas? Do you want to learn about how to cook sustainably using what is seasonally available at the market? 
 Join sustainable chef Ben Mac from We Eat Local for this FREE 1-hour cooking workshop that highlights the best local food from London Farmers Markets!
 During the workshop you will hear directly from these amazing local farmers who will share their stories. Prepare to get inspired by amazing ingredients and learn simple but delicious recipes that use seasonal fresh produce. 
 This cooking workshop will be fun, educational and delicious - and absolutely free. Participants will be sent a copy of the recipes after the event.

events.name: Online Life Drawing
events.description:
We can’t wait to get back in the swing of regular life drawing sessions so we’re going online until restrictions on indoor gatherings are lifted.
 We know times are tight! That's why our online life drawing sessions are now 100% donation-based. We always pay our models so chip in if you can! <3
 Our sessions feature: 
 - Professional Models of all types from New York City's huge talent pool.- Professional Cameras and Lighting.- 2x Camera Angles to choose from

events.name: Wellness Workshop: Understanding Our Indoor Cats
events.description:
In the grand scale of human-animal companionship, cats have only recently been considered domesticated pets. There's still much to learn about our feline friends and the spaces we share with them. Be sure to join us for a special two-part workshop, as Dr. Margie Scherk helps us better understand how we can help our cats flourish.
 Keeping cats indoors is considered to be the responsible way to keep a cat safe. An indoor cat won’t be hit by a car, killed by a predator, get into fights and is at a lower risk for some infectious diseases. Right? But what if there are dangers associated with this lifestyle? What if we are, inadvertently causing illness and distress? What preventive health and behavioral needs do these individuals have? This presentation will look at both sides and how to optimize the indoor life for all cats.
 There are many beliefs about cats that are untrue. Many are about how best to care for cats (recognizing sickness, preventive health care needs of indoor housed cats, optimal age for spaying or castration, what to feed cats). Others are about the people they live with (how to feed cats, teaching cats, what purring means, pregnancy and toxoplasmosis)

events.name: Make Your Own Terrarium
events.description:
Why not try your hand at a calming DIY project with this make your own terrarium online class and craft kit?
 If you’re interested in testing out your green gardening fingers, but don’t have the space to do so, a DIY terrarium is just what you need. These mini tabletop gardens are fun to create and are a great way to perk up your indoor space.
 Don't worry if you're new to this unique craft, with this online class and DIY kit, you'll learn how to make a terrarium with this help of an expert! Plus, you'll have all the supplies to make your own terrarium a special mini-jungle paradise!

events.name: Online Ball Mastery football session
events.description:
Total Ballers Acadmey will be running a free, public football indoors session for boys and girls to continue to learn individual ball skills at their feet. For 5-15years old
 It will challenge your child to manlipate them ball in various ways to continue their growth in their footballing journey during this difficult time.
 They will learn how to use both feet, different parts of their feet and loads more. And the best thing is that is FREE!

events.name: Full Moon Forest Bathing Walk
events.description:
TRemotely guided walks are audio-guided using the Zoom app and can be experienced in a space as little as 200 square feet, and may take place in your backyard or a nearby natural area. You may also choose to experience this from indoors near a window to the outdoors. To bring yourself closer to nature, you might like to have a few natural elements such a rock, a shell, a feather, or a houseplant. These walks are more of a pulsing walk than a linear walk. You can choose a base location and experience each part of the walk in that area.
 Forest Therapy walks begin with slowing down and moving into your senses. Throughout the walk, you will be offered unique opportunities, called “invitations”, to mindfully interact and connect with the landscape around you. Invitations encourage presence, connection, wonder, tranquility, and a sense of union with nature. Walks typically conclude with a ceremony of sharing tea so please bring an insulated mug of a tea to enjoy. There will be optional opportunities to share and reflect on your experiences throughout the walk.

events.name: Getting Started | Hiking
events.description:
Join us for a virtual kick-off to the season with a lesson in getting started hiking! Adventure athlete and international speaker Georgina Miranda will share tips and stories in order to safely prepare for getting into hiking. Topics will include trip planning, activity selection, gear, essentials, injury prevention and more. At the end, we'll wrap up with a Q & A session.
 Register here and we'll send out viewing information to you before the event. On the day of the event, grab a snack, click the link and follow along. The presentation will include visuals with information about each topic. We'll cover all areas then follow up with questions. If you have questions, you will be able to submit them in the Q & A area in Zoom. The host will compile questions for the Q & A at the end of the event. This event is suitable for people of all ages.

events.name: Local Adventure Cycling by Tom Limon
events.description: A great place to ride your bike is in your own backyard and there is help to do that. Biketropolis curates day-long adventure cycling tours through historical neighborhoods, urban archeological ruins, street art, and interesting destinations. In response to the pandemic, they created a series of self-guided bike tours all over the city. Join us to hear Tom Limon, from Biketropolis talk about the tours and his insider tips for planning routes. This event is sponsored by Earth Rider Cycling and the Chicago Cycling Club.

events.name: Camp In, Camp Out
events.date: Sat, Apr 24, 2021, 10:00 PM –Sun, Apr 25, 2021, 4:00 AM CEST
events.description: Girl Scouts of Northeast Texas is proud to host Camp In, Camp Out. This semi-virtual event is a great way to observe Earth Day, celebrate the outdoors, and learn about sustainability. This is a family-friendly event but only girls need to register.*Note: because this is a virtual event, there are many self-guided elements. Girls and families are welcome to engage in as much or as little of the programming as they wish based on what fits their needs and interests.

events.name: Outdoor Adventurers of Color
events.description:
Outdoor Adventurers of Color is a monthly series exploring opportunities for outdoor recreation, socialization, and engagement.
 Ranita Anderson, Outdoor Afro Raleigh-Durham Leader, will share about how she developed a love for outdoor exploration leading her to pursue leadership roles in helping Black people find joy in nature. She will also highlight goals around supporting Black children and families in outdoor learning and recreation.

events.name: Learning From Each Other 2: Loneliness
events.description:
Throughout the Covid 19 pandemic estranged students have been struggling even more than usual with feelings of isolation and loneliness. Our first survey during the March 2020 lockdown found that 55% of HE students without family support said they were particularly worried about feeling lonely. The most recent survey in January 21 led by Unite Foundation showed that 27% of respondents are still lacking enough social interaction. Even if campuses are able to start opening up again after Easter and students can start to reconnect with their peers and their institutions, we know that loneliness and isolation is one of the main issues estranged students are always having to cope with.
 In this virtual 'Learning From Each Other' session we want to explore what universities and colleges can do to alleviate loneliness among estranged students who haven't been able to return to a family home during periods of lockdown but also looking ahead beyond the restrictions of the pandemic. Most of these students have no emotional support from family so look to their friends and often their institutions for support, especially in times of crisis.

events.name: Beauty Brunch Online
events.description:
Beauty Brunch is a place for women to connect, be inspired, be real, and be healed.Beauty Brunch is an online event that unites women of all walks of life and all denominations to meet a loving and compassionate Christ. Every women who joins instantly feels the authenticity and love cultivated by the Until We Arise team. A t Beauty Brunch women have the chance to really connect with other women.
 For returning guests, Beauty Brunch is going back to our roots and making this a very plush and special event for women and girls. Just like in  previous seasons, you can expect. Beauty Brunch to include moving worship, real talk, powerful stories, and some fun games.

events.name: Choose the change, Leading alone: A More Human Workplace Gathering
events.description:
Leaders continue to face unprecedented challenges and incredibly difficult decisions in the face of this continued and worsening pandemic. We worry for our team members and our organizations' viability while trying to adjust to the latest demands and restrictions. Even with the vaccines and vaccinations moving ahead, the uncertainty of how we can lead our organizations and teams in the new realities. While some of us have gotten experienced at leading virtual work, others are still struggling.
 We may be discovering benefits but also grappling with serious consequences with no clear answers. And as we struggle to help our teams adapt, we may face loneliness, stress, overwhelm, sleep issues, malaise, uncertainty, and challenges working with kids at home. We may even question our value and purpose.

events.name: Home Alone? How to collaborate and work better together in a virtual world.
events.description:
Continuing this series of bi-weekly leadership seminars, this session is a highly practical look at how we can collaborate better, and what gets in the way. This is relevant to any working environment although working virtually has definitely brought another layer of both possibility and challenge.
 This session is relevant to anyone in a team, or working on a project with others, especially if it's a project about social change where you want to move hearts and minds. What gets in the way and how can we do better?

events.name: Home Alone? How to collaborate and work better together in a virtual world.
events.description:
Continuing this series of bi-weekly leadership seminars, this session is a highly practical look at how we can collaborate better, and what gets in the way. This is relevant to any working environment although working virtually has definitely brought another layer of both possibility and challenge.
 This session is relevant to anyone in a team, or working on a project with others, especially if it's a project about social change where you want to move hearts and minds. What gets in the way and how can we do better?

events.name: Campus Conversations: You are not alone: an I Scream Social
events.organizer: New College: The Andrew W. Mellon Foundation Grant
events.description: Our inaugural I Scream Social is designed to empower student writers, encourage literary culture, and channel our “real world” experiences into meaningful literary performances. This year’s event will feature a collaboration with Booker Middle School Teacher and Dragonfly Poetry Café founder Joanna Fox. This winter and spring, New College students and Dragonfly Poetry Café students have embarked on an extraordinary correspondence in which they create characters, are assigned each other’s characters as pen pals, and exchange letters from their characters’ point of view. Curious? Confused? Join us to learn more about how these students are using their creativity as a catalyst for connection in disconnecting times. The event will feature Dr. Carr and Joanna Fox in conversation about their collaboration, and short readings by New College students who were part of this extraordinary correspondence. We’ll end with information about the new AOC in Creative Writing at New College.

events.name: Tough Discussions at Work - Essential Training for Anyone Not Working Alone
events.description: Facilitators: Dave Veale, CEC, PCC, Vision Coaching and Kelly VanBuskirk, Q.C., Infopowered Solutions. Researchers have proven that 70 per cent of employees are avoiding difficult conversations with their bosses, colleagues, and direct reports.At Harvard Business School, Leslie Perlow and Stephanie Williams found that a “reign of silence” exists in many businesses when it comes to differences of opinion, and that causes “skilled incompetence.Employment lawyers know first-hand that many managers avoid having tough discussions with their employees. Often, managers gloss over the challenging feedback that workers need to develop and improve – and that leads to messy terminations.In this seminar, you will not only learn how to have tough conversations, you will actually have them!

events.name: Movie Chat
events.description: Whether you're a movie buff or just love a good film, join us online for Movie Chat. You can watch our film suggestion and tell us what you thought of the film.Seen other great films? Why not join us and recommend something you liked.This event will take place via Microsoft Teams. To register, select your preferred date and you will receive a link to join on the day.

events.name: Korean Film Nights
events.description: For our Spring edition of Korean Film Nights, we present short films from two innovative YouTube channels. In the era of Coronavirus we have witnessed the film industry shifting online, and these offerings showcase the rising stars who have continued to draw audiences of thousands to view their imaginative, dramatic and artistic works.Part of cutting edge YouTube channel Salon De 0.5 F (Underground Salon), directors Kim Soy (My Eggs) and Kim Kkobbi (I Love Camping) will be joining us on April 1 to discuss their innovative short films and expansive careers.

events.name: Virtual Film Discussion: 'I Know A Woman Like That'
events.description: I Know a Woman Like That brings to its audience interviews with 17 exceptional and vigorous women who share an extraordinary attitude about how to live the upper decades of one's life. Each of them exercises an unexpected passion for their unique individual choices at a time when society expects them to disappear. These women were carving out unique paths before the social revolution had a name. Roger Ebert called the documentary transformational.

events.name: Classic Films Trivia
events.description: Join us for our Trivia Tuesday event! This week, test your knowledge on classic films.You must register with your email address in order to receive the link to participate. The link will be sent to you by email approximately one day before the discussion. You will need a device with audio and/or video and an internet connection to join.

events.name: Freedom Friday
events.description: Friday night is Movie night at Crypto Blockchain Plug! Open Discussion, Network and Win! Our film this week is
